meanings.definition: To deprive of the status of being established, especially as a state church.
meanings.sent1: The government disestablished the official church, removing its special status.
meanings.sent2: After much debate, the decision was made to disestablish the long-standing state church.
meanings.sent3: The king disestablished the royal church and declared everyone could worship freely.
meanings.sent4: The revolutionary movement aimed to disestablish the traditional church, breaking its hold on society.
meanings.sent5: The act to disestablish the state church was met with both support and opposition.

meanings.definition: To abolish an established system or institution.
meanings.sent1: The new law disestablished the outdated education system, paving the way for reforms.
meanings.sent2: In order to modernize, the company decided to disestablish its old hierarchical structure.
meanings.sent3: The decision to disestablish the old rules brought a wave of excitement among the employees.
meanings.sent4: The reform movement sought to disestablish the corrupt institutions that held power for too long.
meanings.sent5: The plan to disestablish the traditional system was met with mixed reactions from the public.
